intro: Hygrophila gracillima, commonly known as the slender hygrophila, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist environments, such as marshes and along the edges of slow-moving water bodies. Hygrophila gracillima is often used in aquatic gardening and as a decorative plant in water features.
